        public boolean isBody(org.jbox2d.dynamics.Body pBody)

      • position

        public org.jbox2d.common.Vec2 position()
        DO NOT CHANGE. current position of the robot in world coordinates.
        Returns:

      • addSensor

        public Sensor addSensor(float pAngle,
                        float pRadius)
        adds a sensor to the robot and returns the instance of the new sensor. number and radius of sensors are limitied.
        Parameters:
        pAngle - angle in relation to the forward direction of the robot, in radians
        pRadius - distance from the robots center
        Returns:

      • update

        public void update()
        this method is called automatically by the environment each frame. implement the robots *thinking* in here.

      • steer

        public void steer(float pAngle)
        set the steering angle of the robot. the desired angle is not necessarily achieved immediately.
        Parameters:
        pAngle - steering angle in relation to the robots forward direction, in radians

      • steerDeg

        public void steerDeg(float pAngleInDegrees)
        set the steering angle of the robot. the desired angle is not necessarily achieved immediately.
        Parameters:
        pAngleInDegrees - steering angle in relation to the robots forward direction, in degrees

      • steer

        public float steer()
        returns the current, desired steering angle. the return value of this method does not necessarily match the actual steering angle. see 'steer(float pAngle)'
        Returns:
        steering angle in relation to the robots forward direction, in radians

      • steerDeg

        public float steerDeg()
        returns the current, desired steering angle. the return value of this method does not necessarily match the actual steering angle. see 'steer(float pAngle)'
        Returns:
        steering angle in relation to the robots forward direction, in degrees

      • speed

        public float speed()
        return the speed of the robot. the return value of this method does not necessarily match the actual speed. see 'speed(float pSpeed)'
        Returns:

      • speed

        public void speed(float pSpeed)
        set the speed of the robot. the desired speedis not necessarily achieved immediately.
        Parameters:
        pSpeed - desired robots speed

      • draw

        public void draw(processing.core.PGraphics g)
        override this methods to draw into the robots local space.
        Parameters:
        g - use this PGraphics to send drawing commands to like e.g. 'g.line(0, 5, 10, 20);'
